alert.note: Alert for Mendocino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 07 at 4:03PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Minor Flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Garcia River near Point Arena. * WHEN...Until 100 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Flooding of Highway 1 near the Garcia River in Mendocino County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 327 PM PST, The Garcia River the stage was 11.15 feet. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. - Forecast...The river will continue to rise above flood stage during the next hour an peak to 12.7 feet tomorrow around noon. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow night to 9.8 feet. Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of South Central Mendocino County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
